channel.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
channel.description:
according to the news post on the main runescape site, Jagex wins. :) [url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/g=runescape/jagex-vs-ibot--anti-bot-update]http://services.runescape.com/m=news/g=runescape/jagex-vs-ibot--anti-bot-update[/url]
i for one, am completely against botting, and see this as a first step towards stamping out the diseases known as "botting" and "gold farming" that plague the runescape world. Hopefully Jagex does what they say they will do, and stamp out color bots and screen-scrapers in the near future.
discuss. ;o

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

ITT everyone is a lawyer and knows best.

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

So when you said “open source” would fix the problem, you meant that decentralisation would. Which is possible, but it also introduces a bunch of new problems. Open source doesn’t fix anything.

As for only being able to be sued if you use their copyrighted code, images etc, it not being illegal “to cost companies money” - tortious interference exists, and botting companies have been successfully sued over it. You don’t magically win the law game on technical details.

It was just admitted above that the users would be in breach of their contract with Jagex - congratulations, you are now interfering with that contract by encouraging users to break it and open to a lawsuit. Don’t believe me? Ask MDY Industries…

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“dunlopghost, post:48, topic:430853”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=533531.msg3902046#msg3902046 date=1327857342]

[quote author=cruel link=topic=533531.msg3902034#msg3902034 date=1327857164]

sure, offer the threat - many will back off, take them to court to make them even more scared. regardless of who wins in any court case, it costs both parties time and money.

Umm… if that was even a possibility they’d be doing that right now instead of just banning botters.
Botting isn’t illegal… so I still don’t understand the legal claims that’d be made.

they’ve actually done it.

I could take your word for it, but I’d just like to know what the legal grounds would be to file a lawsuit against people cheating on a game.

the people profiting

So… the users? Hundreds of kids using it would get sued for what? Breaking game policy?
[/quote]What? More like the people who can buy fancy houses and cars with their newfound fortune.

we’re talking about the hypothetical situation where the bot is open-source and decentralized (w/o official maintainer). The coders would have no profit.
[/quote]Ad money. RSBot operates like this.

RSbot profits from Ad money, but Paris is the biggest fraud i’ve ever seen. he acts like a nice guy and does his best to hide the fact he was definitely involved with AND at fault for the rsbot mass account hacking a while ago. it’s quite obvious that he probably sold the stolen rsgp to Powerbot’s sponsor, Gold4Fun.

in my opinion, RSbot/Powerbot doesn’t even qualify as a bot anymore. just a client to give your accounts away to Paris and Wei-Su so he can sell your GP/Items for real profit.[/quote]I never said Paris (aka ins3) was any good. He coup’d me and hijacked the website, so you could say i have first hand experience

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @dunlopghost dunlopghost
item.description:
@dunlopghost wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:43, topic:430853”][quote author=cruel link=topic=533531.msg3902034#msg3902034 date=1327857164]

sure, offer the threat - many will back off, take them to court to make them even more scared. regardless of who wins in any court case, it costs both parties time and money.

Umm… if that was even a possibility they’d be doing that right now instead of just banning botters.
Botting isn’t illegal… so I still don’t understand the legal claims that’d be made.

they’ve actually done it.

I could take your word for it, but I’d just like to know what the legal grounds would be to file a lawsuit against people cheating on a game.

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=533531.msg3901736#msg3901736 date=1327833693]

the people profiting

So… the users? Hundreds of kids using it would get sued for what? Breaking game policy?
[/quote]What? More like the people who can buy fancy houses and cars with their newfound fortune.

we’re talking about the hypothetical situation where the bot is open-source and decentralized (w/o official maintainer). The coders would have no profit.
[/quote]Ad money. RSBot operates like this.[/quote]

RSbot profits from Ad money, but Paris is the biggest fraud i’ve ever seen. he acts like a nice guy and does his best to hide the fact he was definitely involved with AND at fault for the rsbot mass account hacking a while ago. it’s quite obvious that he probably sold the stolen rsgp to Powerbot’s sponsor, Gold4Fun.

in my opinion, RSbot/Powerbot doesn’t even qualify as a bot anymore. just a client to give your accounts away to Paris and Wei-Su so he can sell your GP/Items for real profit.

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:44, topic:430853”]An open source bot with adverts… I guess. If they don’t mind the fact that people can just clone the repo and make another w/o adverts which ppl would flock to.
But regardless, the other contributors wouldn’t be charged.[/quote]That never really happened though. People tend to stick to products that are well known and trusted, so if the original authors do it right, people don’t want to go for competitors.

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:35, topic:430853”]It’s likewise not illegal to cost companies money. Breaking a TOS would merit a termination of service (banning). Which is exactly what they do, because it’s all they can do.
And even so, the only clear targets would be those people whom rent out their boxes as a massive botting enterprise. Anyone familiar with Jagex filing lawsuits against botting services? Sounds plausible.
But regardless, the target would never be the coders whom contributed to the open source project.[/quote]

I completely agree with you. The only reason impsoft lost IMHO, was because of the other things they did, the way they went about botting. Not the actual botting itself. For one, they distributed jagex’s code with ibot, instead of just having the program modify it on the client’s computer. And they also infringed on jagex’s copyrighted images and text, which they used for their website. I think, even with an ‘official maintainer’ they wouldn’t go after open source code in a lawsuit, because it’s expensive, and there is nothing to gain.

Read full topic

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

An open source bot with adverts… I guess. If they don’t mind the fact that people can just clone the repo and make another w/o adverts which ppl would flock to.
But regardless, the other contributors wouldn’t be charged.

item.title: Impsoft Loses to Jagex
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

It’s likewise not illegal to cost companies money. Breaking a TOS would merit a termination of service (banning). Which is exactly what they do, because it’s all they can do.
And even so, the only clear targets would be those people whom rent out their boxes as a massive botting enterprise. Anyone familiar with Jagex filing lawsuits against botting services? Sounds plausible.
But regardless, the target would never be the coders whom contributed to the open source project.

Read full topic
